examples: My legs get achy.
You might feel tired and achy after getting it, but that's not an infection.
Ugh, your head hurts, you're nauseated, you're achy, and you are certainly never drinking again.
I was in bed by 7:00, achy, feverish, fatigue.
The first one, as I say, the first day, I was fine, the second day, started to get a little achy, a little muscle pain, muscle soreness, joint soreness.
words.defineEn: experiencing a consistent yet dull physical pain in a part of one's body
words.defineVi: trải qua một cơn đau thể xác nhất quán nhưng âm ỉ trong một phần cơ thể của một người

examples: The struggles of black farmers have been particularly acute.
The last one was an acute angle.
The acute medical therapy is indicated in the exposure.
So this is an acute angle right over here.
When we cut it into slices, each of the eight triangles is acute.
words.defineEn: (of an illness) suddenly becoming severe but for a short time
words.defineVi: (của một căn bệnh) đột nhiên trở nên nghiêm trọng nhưng trong một thời gian ngắn

examples: New uniforms bolster British morale for this agonizing march.
And her bite could give you an agonizing case of dengue fever.
Knowing that your own brain is lying to you while not being able to resist its commands can be agonizing.
There are also a few that are incredibly agonizing.
I have interviewed him for my book, and he recounted in agonizing detail the ordeal he had to suffer.
words.defineEn: causing a lot of difficulty, pain, or discomfort
words.defineVi: gây ra nhiều khó khăn, đau đớn hoặc khó chịu

examples: This shutdown is really crippling.
They do unimaginable damage, by crippling countless people, they destroy billions of dollars in income each year, weaken communities, and slow progress.
We turn to Iran, the target of former President Trump's so-called maximum pressure campaign aimed at crippling Tehran's economy.
Mandel has written a new book called 'Here's the Deal, Don't Touch Me,' revealing his at times crippling struggle with OCD.
The tiny English car gave the world a revolutionary design that boosted the British car industry and helped consumers comfortably save fuel during a crippling fuel crisis.
words.defineEn: Inflicting damage or injuries so severe that causes a person to be physically disabled
words.defineVi: Gây thiệt hại hoặc thương tích nghiêm trọng đến mức khiến một người bị tàn tật về thể chất

examples: We were shut down for two excruciating months.
- Whoever comes over here next is going to listen to my childhood memories in excruciating detail.
At the time Matthew Carey, a local publisher, wrote a lengthy treatise filled with excruciating death scenes.
That means that this explosion has been studied in excruciating detail since the day its light reached Earth.
Since we walk upright, gravity pulls on our exposed testes, which can lead to a potentially excruciating condition called inguinal hernia.
words.defineEn: extremely painful
words.defineVi: vô cùng đau đớn

examples: So, he said it's very inflamed.
words.defineEn: (of a part of the body)  red, swollen, or painful, often as a result of an infection, injury, or disease
words.defineVi: (của một bộ phận cơ thể) đỏ, sưng hoặc đau, thường là do nhiễm trùng, chấn thương hoặc bệnh tật

examples: Hearing the train whistle at night gives me itchy feet.
Every so often, Claire has itchy feet and sets off for a foreign destination.
Hearing about Sally's job had given me itchy feet and within a couple of months I left the company.
I hated living in London, and I started getting itchy feet.
This hat is so itchy!
words.defineEn: experiencing or causing an annoying feeling on the skin that makes a person want to scratch it
words.defineVi: trải qua hoặc gây ra cảm giác khó chịu trên da khiến một người muốn gãi

examples: Having strong feelings for someone when those feelings aren't returned can be very painful.
As an American, she had little truck with the painful formality of English life.
It was a painful reminder that advice is least heeded when most needed.
It was a painful reminder that an empty purse frightens away friends.
As a runner, I know that pushing yourself to the limit can be painful.
words.defineEn: causing emotional or physical pain in someone
words.defineVi: gây ra nỗi đau tinh thần hoặc thể xác trong một ai đó

examples: Something became painfully clear to me.
Not to mention almost painfully loud.
It's a painfully slow process.
I've been thinking about it painfully for a long time.
Panagiotis Tzanavaris is painfully aware that financially strapped Greece has other priorities.
words.defineEn: in a way that causes physical or emotional discomfort or suffering
words.defineVi: theo cách gây ra sự khó chịu hoặc đau khổ về thể chất hoặc cảm xúc

examples: With pandemic raging, Jerry Seinfeld says now is not a time for comedy.
AMNA NAWAZ: With the pandemic raging and the nation's economy teetering, this might seem like a strange time to start a business.
words.defineEn: very severe
words.defineVi: rất nghiêm trọng

examples: The severest toil was child's play compared with this.
When the company's financial problems became too severe to overcome, the CEO called in a financial consultant for advice.
The company's prowess in driving a hard bargain has placed severe pressure on suppliers.
Trauma surgeons work tirelessly to save lives, but ultimately they realize there is a remedy for everything except death and must accept that some injuries are simply too severe.
Fibroids can cause severe pain.
words.defineEn: very bad, harsh, or intense
words.defineVi: rất xấu, khắc nghiệt, hoặc dữ dội

examples: Keep a sharp lookout for David.
With a sharp knife, the chef expertly removed the gristle from the pork chops.
He remained sharp as a tack.
She felt a sharp pain in her hand.
He's as sharp as a tack.
words.defineEn: keenly and painfully felt; as if caused by a sharp edge or point
words.defineVi: cảm nhận sâu sắc và đau đớn; như thể gây ra bởi một cạnh hoặc điểm sắc nét

examples: as she massaged her sore feet.
The sunset over the Strait of Malacca is a sight for sore eyes.
You're a sight for sore eyes!
In Japan a European stands out like a sore thumb.
The movie was great but the CGI was a sight for sore eyes.
words.defineEn: (of a body part) painful, sensitive, or aching
words.defineVi: (của một bộ phận cơ thể) đau đớn, nhạy cảm, hoặc nhức nhối

words.defineEn: suffering from agoraphobia; abnormally afraid of open or public places
words.defineVi: mắc chứng sợ khoảng rộng; bất thường sợ những nơi mở hoặc công cộng

words.defineEn: relating to anemia or suffering from anemia
words.defineVi: liên quan đến thiếu máu hoặc bị thiếu máu

words.defineVi: của hoặc liên quan đến viêm khớp

words.defineVi: tạm thời chóng mặt hoặc bất tỉnh sau khi bị va đập, thổi hoặc giật mạnh vào đầu

examples: A dehydrated brain works harder to accomplish the same amount as a normal brain, and it even temporarily shrinks because of its lack of water.
They proposed that the microbes would become dehydrated, spore-like things, floating around in the lower atmosphere.
Rationing off water is bad because you can put yourself in a dehydrated state.
And also our skin can start to sag, because our body relys on hydration and if we're purging chances are that we are pretty dehydrated.
Sea snakes going this way could become dehydrated and die.
words.defineEn: suffering from excessive loss of water from the body
words.defineVi: bị mất quá nhiều nước từ cơ thể

examples: Most diabetics need two to four vials per month.
Alec’s official cause of death was diabetic ketoacidosis.
Some diabetics live day-to-day and week-to-week on supplies.
I'm diabetic, man.
Many diabetics, not all diabetics, but many diabetics need to take insulin daily.
words.defineEn: of or relating to or causing diabetes
words.defineVi: của, liên quan đến hoặc gây ra bệnh tiểu đường

examples: But in fMRI studies with dyslexic patients, parts of these systems, like the temporal cortex, have shown lower levels of activation when they read.
On the other hand, a dyslexic brain is more like a camera with a slower shutter speed so instead of capturing the wings clearly, it captures a blur.
Really, though, there are many types of the disorder and many different components of reading, so there’s no single type of dyslexic brain.
And they proposed that dyslexic patients’ eyes were sending conflicting, mirror images of the world to their brain.
On top of that, a further study by those same authors found that following the six-week training, dyslexic kids’ reading skills improved, even without any specific reading training.
words.defineEn: having a learning disorder that affects a person's ability to read, write, and spell
words.defineVi: bị rối loạn học tập ảnh hưởng đến khả năng đọc, viết và đánh vần của một người

examples: The study involved three epileptic people who previously had electrodes implanted in their brains to help with their condition.
And they found that epileptic seizures were more likely to happen on darker nights.
So the full moon doesn’t trigger seizures, but epileptic seizures do somehow seem to be linked to lunar cycles.
The number of epileptic seizures was actually lowest during the full moon and highest during the last quarter.
They're searching for a scent that no human can detect: the scent of an epileptic seizure.
words.defineEn: of or relating to or characteristic of epilepsy
words.defineVi: của, liên quan đến hoặc đặc điểm của bệnh động kinh

words.defineEn: injured by freezing or partial freezing
words.defineVi: bị thương do đóng băng hoặc đóng băng một phần

examples: They haven't figured out why he's incontinent.
words.defineEn: not having control over urination and defecation
words.defineVi: không kiểm soát được tiểu tiện và đại tiện

words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc giống hoặc có bệnh phong

examples: The children were extremely malnourished, had very little social interaction with adults, and minimal care from their nurses.
So refusing to yield to the urges won't make you malnourished.
Eating too many of those foods could leave you overweight and malnourished.
Basically, what we saw are dirty children who are malnourished, who are being severely neglected.
They were said to have come from an experienced reptile keeper, but they both came in sick and malnourished and needed some medical attention to get them back to good health.
words.defineEn: not being provided with adequate nourishment

examples: The first hurdle is that arthritis is actually a spectrum of over 100 different arthritic conditions.

words.defineEn: of or pertaining to arthritis

examples: An owl’s eyes are shaped like tubes, and they're held in place by bones called sclerotic rings.

words.defineEn: relating to or having sclerosis; hardened
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc bị xơ cứng; cứng lại

words.defineVi: bị loét hoặc ung thư

examples: It’s basically everything from the moment the Universe big banged up to when the first stars formed, about 400 million years later.
I think he’s gotten really banged up.
I don't really like wearing shoes, like sneakers and socks, anymore because I banged up my foot last year and, ever since, it's been considerably swollen.
Well, I took a wrong turn, and I can now confirm that if you go down like a gypsum, very banged up road, it is quite comfy, So, that's always good to know.
words.defineEn: harmed or injured
words.defineVi: bị hại hoặc bị thương

examples: Her battered body was discovered six days later.
The battered vessel and its 18 sailors were all that remained of a fleet that had departed three years before.

So I keep a listening for the moment when the grief becomes a window When I can see what I couldn’t see before, through the glass of my most battered dream, I watched a dandelion lose its mind in the wind and when it did, it scattered a thousand seeds.
The National Health Service was built from the wreckage of World War II, something of a gift from the government to a battered and impoverished nation, which welcomed it.
words.defineEn: hurt or injured by frequent beatings or punishment
words.defineVi: bị thương hoặc bị thương do bị đánh đập hoặc trừng phạt thường xuyên

examples: The surgeon set her broken arm.

He'd walk around the house repeating his favourite sayings like a broken record.
words.defineEn: physically or mentally weakened as a result of much suffering
words.defineVi: thể chất hoặc tinh thần bị suy yếu do chịu nhiều đau khổ

words.defineVi: tạm thời chóng mặt hoặc bất tỉnh sau khi bị va đập, thổi hoặc giật mạnh vào đầu
